title: 110_hr5515
content: The amendment to Section 233(e) of the Act allows agreements to enter into force after 60 days of transmittal to Congress, excluding non-working days. Documents and reports supporting the agreement must be delivered to both Houses of Congress simultaneously. The amendment to Section 233(e) of the Act allows agreements to enter into force after 60 days of transmittal to Congress. Documents supporting the agreement must be delivered to both Houses of Congress simultaneously, including a determination by the Chief Actuary of the Social Security Administration on the impact over a 75-year period. The amendment to Section 233(e) of the Act allows agreements to enter into force after 60 days of transmittal to Congress. Documents supporting the agreement must be delivered to both Houses of Congress simultaneously, including a determination by the Chief Actuary of the Social Security Administration on the impact over a 75-year period. Over the 75-year period following the date of the entry into force of the agreement, there should be a net reduction in the actuarial balance of the social security system by at least 0.005 percent of the present value of taxable payroll. The term 'taxable payroll' refers to total wages and self-employment income for a period. 'Adjusted summarized income rate' is the ratio of trust fund balance plus total income to taxable payroll. 'Adjusted summarized cost rate' is the ratio of cost plus targeted trust fund balance to taxable payroll. The curr_chunk discusses the calculation of the trust fund balance, income from taxes, and cost during a specific period. It defines terms such as trust fund balance, income from taxes, and cost related to disbursements from the Trust Funds. The curr_chunk defines the term 'cost' as disbursements from the Trust Funds during a period, including benefit payments, administrative expenses, and vocational rehabilitation services for disabled beneficiaries. The curr_chunk discusses payments for vocational rehabilitation services for disabled beneficiaries and defines the term 'target trust fund balance' as the balance needed to support a 100 percent OASDI trust fund ratio. The Chief Actuary uses the intermediate assumptions of the Board of Trustees for making determinations. The Chief Actuary determines payments for vocational rehabilitation services for disabled beneficiaries using the Board of Trustees' assumptions. Agreements under this section must not take effect if a disapproving bill is enacted within 60 days. If a net reduction in the actuarial balance is expected over a 75-year period, the agreement may be affected. Agreements under this section must not take effect if a disapproving bill is enacted within 60 days. If a net reduction in the actuarial balance is expected over a 75-year period, the agreement may be affected. The provisions of this paragraph are enacted by Congress as part of the rules of each House. The provisions in this paragraph, enacted by Congress, are part of the rules of each House regarding disapproval and approval resolutions. They recognize the constitutional right of each House to change its rules related to procedures. The rules of each House allow for changes related to procedures, including the consideration of bills or joint resolutions for approval or disapproval of agreements. Amendments to such agreements are not permitted after transmission to Congress. The amendment prohibits amendments to agreements after transmission to Congress. It applies to totalization arrangements under section 233 of the Social Security Act transmitted to Congress after the enactment date. Additionally, a special rule overrides previous subsections for agreements establishing totalization arrangements between social security systems. The amendment prohibits changes to agreements after being sent to Congress, specifically for totalization arrangements between social security systems. Agreements signed before the enactment date will only enter into force as provided in section 233(e) of the Act. The enactment of this Act prohibits changes to totalization agreements after being sent to Congress. Agreements signed before the enactment date will only enter into force as provided in section 233(e) of the Act. Biennial reports to Congress regarding ongoing operation of totalization agreements are required. "Biennial Oversight Reports are required to update Congress on the ongoing operation of totalization agreements." The Commissioner of Social Security submits biennial reports to Congress evaluating the operation of totalization agreements, including changes in benefit costs and contributions, as well as information on fraudulent receipt of benefits. The Commissioner of Social Security submits biennial reports to Congress evaluating totalization agreements, including changes in benefit costs, fraudulent benefit receipt, integrity of data, and future demographic trends. The Commissioner of Social Security submits biennial reports to Congress evaluating totalization agreements, including demographic trends that may impact future costs to social security systems. The initial report must be submitted by December 31, 2008. SEC. 203. SUSPENSION OF BENEFITS FOR INDIVIDUALS REMOVED FROM THE UNITED STATES. Section 202(n)(1) of the Social Security Act is amended to state that no lump sum death payment will be made to an individual after being notified of their removal from the United States by the Commissioner of Social Security, Attorney General, or Secretary of Homeland Security. These amendments apply to individuals who have been removed from the country. The amendments made by this section apply to individuals notified of their removal from the United States by the Commissioner of Social Security, Attorney General, or Secretary of Homeland Security after the twelfth month following the enactment of this Act.
